title: (x) "Hello" inline bold sans caps - AT Phosphor {Michael Albright}
content:
I thought this might be Cyclone by H&F-J, but I don't think so. Anyone have an idea?

Thanks in advance,

comments.content:
That would be AT Phosphor:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/phosphor/atphosphor/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313163251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/phosphor/atphosphor/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/phosphor/atphosphor/")

And by the way, for those keeping score, HF&J's Cyclone is a wonderful font, able to communicate a variety of moods with surprising versatility. It sets like a charm too. Every word looks like a jewel. Man those Hoefler kids really know how to do it.

Its close to an old Erbar font, don't you think so?

Lichte fette Grotesk  
Ludwig & Mayer, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1924  
Jakob Erbar

Georg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313163251im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_5553.jpg)

You're right Georg, Phosphor and Red Rooster's ['Phosphate'](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313163251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/phosphate-rr/) are almost exact copies of the Erbar typeface. Letraset's ['Follies'](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313163251/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/follies/) is modified more, but still quite similar. However, the '!' mark sets the 'identical' ones apart from the Erbar design, and Michael seems right about 'Phosphor' being the answer this time.

- Mike Yanega
